copper.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu
copper.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a reddish-brown metal used, among other things, for making wire and CABLEs
copper.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: On Friday, copper for March delivery ended at 98.9 cents a pound, up 1.9 cents.
The company is a major producer of copper products.
copper.translation[1].definitions[1].def: coins of low value made of copper or other dark-coloured metals
copper.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He counted out three pounds, all in coppers.
